definition: out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
crossball/bullet/shot/shell/ball
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
grain/food/provisions/agricultural tax paid in grain
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means

sentences.english: As a result, they were surrounded by the army of Qin till the supplies were exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 結果，趙軍被秦軍包圍，直至彈盡糧絕。

sentences.english: And then for eight days, they had nothing.
sentences.chinese: 隨後的八天內，他們彈盡糧絕了。

sentences.english: The little scamp had tempted us to think these kind of weapons were no longer to be found in his artillery.
sentences.chinese: 這個傢伙時常讓我們錯認爲他的武器庫早已彈盡糧絕。

sentences.english: The enemy yielded up that city when ammunition and food supplies were exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 敵人彈盡糧絕，被迫放棄那座城市。
